questions.question: 1. In unit testing, what is typically the scope of a test case?
2. Which pattern separates the system into three interconnected components?
3. What is the main purpose of regression testing?
answers: To ensure that changes have not broken existing functionality
To test the system on different platforms

questions.question: 4. What is the primary measure of progress in Agile methodologies?
5. What is the primary purpose of the Singleton pattern?
answers: To ensure a class has only one instance
To allow an object to alter its behavior when its internal state changes
To separate the construction of a complex object from its representation
To adapt an interface of a class into another interface clients expect

questions.question: 6. What is an essential characteristic of a well-written SRS document according to IEEE standards?
answers: Overly detailed to cover every scenario.

questions.question: 7. How are surveys typically used in the software development process?
answers: To gather user feedback on features
To decide on the programming languages used

questions.question: 8. What is the core principle of Agile software development?
answers: To deliver complete software at the end of the project.
To follow a strict plan with little flexibility.
To prioritize documentation over working software.
To build software incrementally with customer feedback.

questions.question: 9. Which type of software maintenance involves making changes to improve system performance?
10. What is the primary goal of unit testing in software development?
answers: To validate the design of the software
To ensure that individual units of source code work as intended
To assess the performance of the software under load
To verify the final product meets customer requirements

questions.question: 11. According to studies, what is a common outcome of implementing code reviews?
answers: Increased number of bugs in production.

questions.question: 12. What is the primary focus of software maintenance?
answers: Adding new features to the system
Both adding new features and correcting defects

questions.question: 13. In the context of software development, what does SRS stand for?
14. What is the primary goal of software architecture?
answers: To outline the best coding practices
To define the system's structure and behavior
To detail the user interface design

questions.question: 15. What is an important consideration when designing a survey for user feedback?
answers: Limiting the number of questions to five

questions.question: 16. What is a key characteristic of a well-defined software requirement?
17. Which of the following best describes an Agile approach to software development?
answers: Sequential phases with little customer involvement

questions.question: 18. How does the Strategy pattern benefit software design?
answers: By providing a more efficient algorithm for sorting data
By ensuring that objects are always created in a safe manner
By enabling the definition of a family of algorithms and making them interchangeable
By reducing the overall number of objects in the system

questions.question: 19. In the context of the MVC pattern, what does the Controller component do?
answers: It displays the application's user interface
It transforms data for the View component

questions.question: 20. What role does the View component play in MVC?
answers: It displays the user interface and presents data

questions.question: 21. In Agile, what is a user story?
answers: A detailed technical specification of a feature.
A feature described from an end-user perspective.
A test case for validating a feature.

questions.question: 22. Which design pattern is primarily used to create an object while hiding the creation logic?
23. What role do unit tests play in Agile development?
answers: They ensure individual components work as intended, facilitating continuous integration.
They are used only at the final stage of development.
They replace the need for customer feedback.
They are optional and rarely used in Agile development.

questions.question: 24. What is the primary role of the Product Owner in Scrum?
answers: To remove obstacles for the team.
To represent the customer's interest and prioritize the backlog.

questions.question: 25. In Scrum, how is the work for a Sprint determined?
answers: The team selects items from the Product Backlog during Sprint Planning.

questions.question: 26. What is the purpose of the @Ignore annotation in JUnit?
answers: To mark a test that should be executed first
To temporarily disable a test without deleting its code
To indicate that a test method is expecting an exception
To document the reason for test failure

questions.question: 27. What is a key feature of distributed version control systems (DVCS)?
answers: Ability for every user to have a full backup of the repository

questions.question: 28. What is the main benefit of using design patterns in software development?
answers: To reduce the size of the codebase
To increase the execution speed of applications
To eliminate the need for software testing
To provide solutions to common software design problems

questions.question: 29. What is the primary purpose of a code review?
answers: To find and fix mistakes before they become part of the product
To assign tasks to the development team

questions.question: 30. How do code reviews contribute to software security?
answers: By adding more features to the software
By finding and removing common vulnerabilities
By increasing the number of bugs
